documents.document:
@VolcanicArts Because you have taste too?
PS: Try ruby some time
@VolcanicArts That won't fix it any more than GNU Emacs does. It's not that my editor of choice doesn't handle it, it's that it's a fundamental design decision of the language that I find ugly.
@VolcanicArts I use GNU Emacs. It can't touch that. Also... It won't add implicit return to a language that doesn't do implicit return.

I think the toughest thing about coding in python again is having to do without implicit return.
And all that significant whitespace, obviously.
Actually a bit gutted I missed this one! I need to up my glove spotting game. https://t.co/CU48A5tMyx

But.... it looks like it won't use the signature already configured via the online version of Outlook.
Just like the mobile versions don't too.
Arrrgrhrhrhrhrhrhrh!
Okay, turns out it does what you'd want. It was just *very* slow to sync.

Wait..... So the TODO thing in Outlook (the application) isn't the same TODO lists as online Outlook?
Well that makes sense.
Wait... NO IT SODDING DOESN'T!

(actually, I’m getting to know Sphinx right now)
